comments.content:
I'm only posting because this is a postworthy thread.  
This is an O-E ligature from an upcoming font I'm trying  
to get out the door by next Monday.

I call this structure "OE wiper".

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023194706im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oe_wiper_3901.gif)

This one, "OZ wiper", from the land of Oz.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023194706im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oz_wiper_3620.gif)

j a m e s
Follow the OZ wiper with an ellipsis and you have yourself a video game!
Is that the video game that Gary Munch invented?

Wow! Those are adorable, a word that I didn't think could apply to ligatures.

My hope is that people will take this chance to play with otherwise fairly useless or ridiculous letterforms... like putting a Comic Sans "m" into a hillside or whatever. ;)
